story:
Once upon a time, in a peaceful village nestled among the mountains, there lived a young monk named Kavi. Kavi was known for his gentle spirit and kind heart, and he spent his days meditating in the temple and helping the villagers with their daily tasks.

One evening, as the moon rose high in the sky and the stars twinkled brightly, Kavi sat outside the temple, contemplating the beauty of the world around him. Suddenly, he heard a faint rustling in the bushes nearby. Curious, he got up and walked towards the sound, only to discover a tiny squirrel trapped in a thorn bush, its paw caught in the sharp thorns.

Filled with compassion, Kavi carefully untangled the squirrel from the thorns and cradled it gently in his hands. The squirrel looked up at him with wide eyes, its fear melting away in the warmth of Kavi's touch. Kavi whispered soothing words to the squirrel and gently stroked its fur until it calmed down.

As Kavi held the squirrel, he realized the interconnectedness of all living beings and the importance of showing kindness and compassion to every creature, no matter how small. He carried the squirrel to a nearby tree and watched with a smile as it scampered up the branches, grateful for his help.

That night, as Kavi tucked himself into bed in the peaceful temple, he whispered a silent prayer for the squirrel and all beings in the world. And as he drifted off to sleep, he felt a deep sense of peace and contentment knowing that he had made a difference in the life of a tiny creature.

And so, dear child, remember the story of Kavi and the squirrel, and always remember to show kindness and compassion to all beings, for we are all interconnected in this beautiful tapestry of life. Goodnight, sweet dreams, and may you always be guided by the light of love and compassion.
